title: 108_s1685
content: The Act titled "Basic Pilot Program Extension and Expansion Act of 2003" extends the programs and increases the period from 6 to 11 years. It also expands the Basic Pilot Program. The Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 is amended to expand the program to all 50 states by December 1, 2004. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a report evaluating problem resolution by June 1, 2004. The Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 is amended to expand the program to all 50 states by December 1, 2004. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a report evaluating problem resolution by June 1, 2004, and take necessary actions to resolve any outstanding issues before expanding the basic pilot program. Amendments are made to streamline the process. Title IV of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 is amended to replace "Attorney General" with "Secretary of Homeland Security" in all instances. SEC. 4. PILOT IMMIGRATION PROGRAM. The pilot immigration program allows the Secretary of Homeland Security to prioritize petitions for classification under section 203(b)(5) of the Immigration and Nationality Act. Immigrant visas can be issued to aliens in this program in a specific order. Section 610(b) of the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 1993 is amended to extend the time period from "10 years" to "15 years" for immigrant visas issued to aliens under the pilot immigration program. SEC. 5. GAO STUDY. The General Accounting Office will report to Congress on the immigrant investor program, including the number of investors, their countries of origin, settlement locations, citizenship applications, and types of enterprises established. The General Accounting Office will report to Congress on the immigrant investor program, including the types and number of jobs created by the investors. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
